page.title: 09Customs and Traditions
page.content: {Plough Sunday. } A plough is carried into Church for morning service and blessed. {Bell Ringing. } There are six bells in the Church tower. The heaviest bell is the tenor weighing three hundredweight. The bells are rung every Sunday for morning service. The{Old Year}is rung out with muffled bells. Just before midnight the bells are unmuffled and the tenor strikes twelve times. Then the{New Year}is rung in. This Year 1985 has seen the loss of two established members of the tower. The{ringing team}now consists of three men and three women. It is difficult to persuade youngsters to join. {Harvest Supper. } Young and old attend. The supper is held in the Village Hut. Usually some form of light entertainment is held.
